DOC.brief_summary: This study is a Post-Marketing Surveillance study in Korea to evaluate the safety and efficacy of botulinum toxin Type A to treat urinary incontinence in patients with neurogenic detrusor overactivity (NDO) or overactive bladder (OAB) not adequately controlled by anticholinergic drugs.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy of Botulinum Toxin Type A (BOTOX®) to Treat Urinary Incontinence Due to Neurogenic Detrusor Overactivity or Overactive Bladder in Korea
DOC.criteria: Patients with urinary incontinence due to NDO or OAB treated with BOTOX® as per local standard of care in clinical practice.
